com.sonymobile.home.resourceprovider
Class BadgeProviderContract

java.lang.Object
  com.sonymobile.home.resourceprovider.BadgeProviderContract

public final class BadgeProviderContract
extends java.lang.Object

Badge provider data used by a client application to insert its badges in a ContentProvider that handles the client badge updates through inserts. After insertion a badge notification will be set on the client's home screen icon. Only integers are allowed as badge messages. It is not allowed to publish badges on behalf of another client. Attempting to do so will result in a SecurityException

Example: 

 ContentValues contentValues = new ContentValues();
 // Specify the badge count. If zero, the badge notification will be removed.
 // Only non negative integers are allowed.
 contentValues.put(BadgeProviderContract.Columns.BADGE_COUNT, 2);
 // Specify package and activity names associated with badge.
 // Must belong to the process from where the insert is made.
 contentValues.put(BadgeProviderContract.Columns.PACKAGE_NAME, "com.example.badgeapiuser");
 contentValues.put(BadgeProviderContract.Columns.ACTIVITY_NAME, "com.example.badgeapiuser.activity");
 // Insert the badge. Must be done on a background thread.
 // Throws an exception in case the insertion can not be handled.
 try {
    getContentResolver().insert(BadgeProviderContract.CONTENT_URI, contentValues);
 } catch (Exception e) {
 }
Specify app permission:

To be able to insert badges, your app must have the PROVIDER_INSERT_BADGE permission otherwise a SecurityException will be thrown. To request this, add this <uses-permission> element to your manifest file as a child element of <manifest>: <uses-permission android:name="com.sonymobile.home.permission.PROVIDER_INSERT_BADGE" />

See Also:
android.content.AsyncQueryHandler}
